metadata.title: CVE-2020-12864 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - low
metadata.description:
An out-of-bounds read in SANE Backends before 1.0.30 may allow a maliciousdevice connected to the same local network as the victim to read importantinformation, such as the ASLR offsets of the program, aka GHSL-2020-081.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-12864` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libsane - 1.0.29-0ubuntu5.1
libsane-common - 1.0.29-0ubuntu5.1
libsane1 - 1.0.29-0ubuntu5.1
sane-utils - 1.0.29-0ubuntu5.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: sane-backends package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.29-0ubuntu5.1').
